The skin is thick and coarse, and the body is covered with sparse, course hair that ranges in color from reddish-brown to gray. Aardvarks have a long, sticky tongue that they use to feed on ants and termites, which are their primary food source.

Aardvarks are nocturnal animals and spend the majority of the day sleeping in their burrows, which they dig themselves or take over from other animals. They are known for their impressive burrowing abilities, using their strong claws and powerful front legs to dig extensive tunnel systems.

The Cape aardvark is found in a variety of habitats, including savannas, grasslands, and semi-desert regions, throughout southern Africa. They play an important role in their ecosystem, as their burrows provide shelter for various other species and their feeding habits help to control the populations of ants and termites.
